item.title: Bekah add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "Fear's greatest weapon is its ability to blind one to anything. In its presence, we forget there are others to consider, things to save besides ourselves." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Bekah add a quote by Art Spiegelman
item.description: "Samuel Beckett once said, "Every word is like an unnecessary stain on silence and nothingness." ...On the other hand, he SAID it." -- Art Spiegelman

item.title: Bekah add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Bekah add a quote by MIchael Chabon
item.description: "The truth of some promises is not as important as whether or not you can believe in them, with all your heart." -- MIchael Chabon

item.title: Bekah add a quote by Oliver Sacks
item.description: "Language, that most human invention, can enable what, in principle, should not be possible. It can allow all of us, even the congenitally blind, to see with another personâ€™s eyes." -- Oliver Sacks

item.title: Bekah add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Those who don't believe in magic will never find it." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Bekah add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "Handle a book as a bee does a flower, extract its sweetness but do not damage it." -- John Muir

item.title: Bekah add a quote by John Muir
item.description: "I am losing precious days. I am degenerating into a machine for making money. I am learning nothing in this trivial world of men. I must break away and get out into the mountains to learn the news" -- John Muir
